Dear Cody Akers:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Title & (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Section supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
Description perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/1/24, when youth were at the YMCA for a group community
activity, two youth engaged in sexual intercourse in a family stall.
A staff member was checking in on the youth.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
12/6/24 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Therapist
reported on 12/1/24, Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and Staff 1 went
to the YMCA. After returning to the facility, Youth A reported she
and Youth B had sex at the YMCA, therefore Therapist met with
Youth A to discuss the situation further. Youth A reported when
they arrived at the YMCA, Staff 1 was at the front desk trying to
check in, but he was having difficulties and this was taking a while.
Youth A reported she and Youth B went to the family restroom
and locked themselves in a restroom stall. Youth A reported Youth
B asked her many times to have sex with him, and it was her first
time. Youth A reported they were on the floor in the stall at the
YMCA and it was consensual. Later that night, Youth B tried to
beat down Youth A’s door because Youth A told staff what
happened, and he was initially denying anything occurred.
Therapist reported a few days later, Youth B finally admitted he
and Youth A had sex at the YMCA. Youth B told Therapist they
took advantage of Staff 1 by running away from him because
Youth B knew Staff 1 was older and couldn’t move quickly.
Therapist reported Youth A and Youth B were on precautions prior
to going to the YMCA, but no one expected this to happen
because a couple days prior Youth B was holding a weapon, tried
to break in Youth A’s room and threatened to hurt her. Therapist
reported they had no indications Youth A and Youth B liked each
other because they showed no interest in each other prior to this
incident. Therapist reported that’s why they allowed only one staff
to take the youth to the YMCA instead of having two staff.
Therapist reported since the event, staff are always required to be
within arm’s length of Youth A and Youth B. Therapist reported
when staff redirect Youth A and Youth B away from each other or
get in between them, Youth B yells at staff, becomes physically
aggressive towards them and threatens them. Therapist reported
2

there is a no blanket rule in the milieu, but Youth A and Youth B
continue to try and bring blankets out and sit next to each other.
Therapist reported on 12/2/24, Youth A and Youth B kissed each
other when a staff was sitting next to them. Therapist reported
Youth B told her Youth A is the love of his life and no one will keep
them apart.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
12/6/24 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported when youth need to change their clothes, they are
expected to use the family restroom and staff are required to go
into the family restroom area with them and stay with them until
they’re changed. Supervisor reported when staff take youth to the
YMCA, staff are required to always be supervising the youth.
Supervisor reported if youth want to do different activities, they
must do each activity as a group.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 12/11/24 in coordination
with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he took Youth A, Youth B,
and Youth C to the YMCA on 12/1/24. Staff 1 reported when he
used the card to check in, he was told by YMCA staff he couldn’t
get in because his name was not listed as a user. Staff 1 reported
he was required to provide information to create his own account
under Maple Lodge’s account, and this took a while. YMCA staff
told Staff 1 that Youth A, Youth B and Youth C could enter the
facility and begin their activities, but Staff 1 would have to stay
until the check-in process was complete. Staff 1 reported he didn’t
know how long it was going to take, so he told Youth A, Youth B,
and Youth C they could go ahead and get changed. Staff 1
reported he thinks he was only at the desk for 5-6 minutes before
going to the family restroom, but he wasn’t sure. Staff 1 reported
when he arrived at the family restroom, none of the youth were
there. Staff 1 reported he couldn’t go into the pool area, so he
went to the observation area and saw all three youth in the pool.
Staff 1 reported he was standing on the track watching them. Staff
1 reported shortly after, Youth B left the pool area, got changed,
came upstairs, and they lifted weights together while Youth A and
Youth C continued swimming. Staff 1 reported Youth B went to
play basketball, and shortly later Youth A and Youth C changed
and watched Youth B play basketball. After about 30 minutes,
they left and went back to the facility. Staff 1 reported he didn’t
find out about Youth A and Youth B having sex at the YMCA until
later in the shift when Youth C talked to another staff (couldn’t
remember who) about what happened. Staff 1 reported he is
aware staff are supposed to be in the family restroom with youth
while they are changing to provide supervision. Staff 1 reported he
3

had a lack of judgement while at the YMCA and he should have
had the three youth stay with him during the check in process
rather than letting them get changed on their own.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/6/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported she
went to the YMCA with Youth B, Youth C, and Staff 1. Youth A
reported while Staff 1 was checking them in, she and the other
two youth went to the family restroom to get changed. Youth A
reported it is normal to go to the family restroom without staff
present and it depends which staff are working whether they’ll
supervise them or not. Youth A reported Staff 1 never came into
the restroom with them and never called out to them to check on
them. Youth A reported she and Youth B went into a bathroom
that had a shower, shut the door and had consensual sex. Youth
A reported Youth C told her they were in there approximately 20
minutes. Youth A reported after they were done, she and Youth B
got dressed. Youth A reported she went with Youth C to go
swimming while Youth B went upstairs to work out with Staff 1.
Youth A reported after swimming, she and Youth C got dressed
and then they all went back to the facility. Youth A reported they
have a safety plan they shouldn’t be around each other, but she
and Youth B have feelings for each other. Youth A reported staff
are constantly reminding them to stay away from each other,
redirecting them, and getting in between them. Youth A reported
Youth B is annoyed by their constant reminders. Youth A reported
she and Youth B are supposed to stay 6 feet away from each
other, and staff enforce it to an annoying extent.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/6/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported he went
to the YMCA with Staff 1, Youth A, and Youth C. Youth B reported
while Staff 1 was getting them checked in, Youth B, Youth C, and
Youth A went to the family locker room to get changed. Youth B
reported he felt they took advantage of going ahead of Staff 1
because he is older, isn’t the best walker, and is slower than them.
Youth B reported he and Youth A went into the same bathroom
stall and came out about 5 minutes later. Youth B reported he and
Youth A had sex while they were in the stall, and it was
consensual. Youth B reported Youth C was in the main locker
room area and told Youth B and Youth A that Staff 1 came in once
to check on them. Youth B reported he put his stuff into a locker,
and then walked out. Youth B reported he played basketball while
Youth A and Youth C swam. Youth B reported there’s been a
safety plan between he and Youth A since he arrived at the facility
on 11/4/24, due to allegations Youth A made against Youth B (SIR
4

#2025SIC0000087) but a new safety plan has been developed
since this incident. Youth B reported staff are always intervening
between he and Youth A, but he and Youth A aren’t listening to
them because they want to be by each other. Youth B reported
staff always want distance between them, and staff supervision
has been more intense.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 12/6/24
in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported on
12/1/24, Staff 1 took her, Youth A and Youth B to the YMCA.
Youth C reported Staff 1 was taking a long time checking them in,
so she asked Staff 1 if they could go to the locker room and get
changed while he finished. Youth C reported Staff 1 gave them
permission and said he was going to exercise after he checked in.
Youth C reported she, Youth A, and Youth B went into the family
locker room. Youth C reported Youth A and Youth B went into the
handicap shower room together and turned on the shower. Youth
C reported she could hear them having sex, and they were in
there for approximately 45-50 minutes. Youth C reported normally
staff are in the locker room with them, and they’ve never been left
alone in the locker room without staff unless Staff 1 takes them to
the YMCA (further information was not provided regarding what
this meant.) Youth C reported she eventually left and went
swimming because she was disgusted about what they were
doing. Youth C reported Youth A finally came out and swam for
approximately 10 minutes, but then wanted to stop because she
said she “hurt too much down there”. Youth C reported she knew
Youth A and Youth B were going to have sex at the YMCA if they
got a chance because they were talking about it at the facility prior
to leaving to go to the YMCA. Youth C reported when they got
back to the facility, she encouraged Youth A to tell staff what
happened because she needed to protect herself. Youth C
reported Youth A told staff what happened and then Youth B went
crazy breaking stuff and threatening everyone. Youth C reported
staff are doing a great job supervising them at the home, but
Youth A and Youth B won’t listen to redirections and ignore when
staff get in between them.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Agency Response Strategy dated 12/3/24 states Youth A
and Youth B are both on precaution plans for boundaries.
Youth A and Youth B are not able to go on outings
currently. Youth A and Youth B have received STI testing
and Youth A was provided with a Plan B pill per her
request. A 30-day notice was provided requesting Youth B
be moved from the placement.
5

• Youth A and Youth B precaution plans dated 11.5.24 state
Youth A and Youth B are not allowed to sit next to each
other.
• Youth A and Youth B safety provisions plans dated
11/13/24 state there were reports of a sexual
incident/inappropriate boundary between Youth A and
Youth B on 11/4/24 (SIR #2025SIC0000087). To ensure
safety of both residents, they need to be separated, and
staff are to redirect them or sit/step in between them. Staff
are to closely monitor both residents when near each other.
They will not be alone together at the facility or on outings
without staff present.
• Incident Reports for Youth A and Youth B for 12/1/24
incident report states Youth A and Youth B snuck off to the
bathroom at the YMCA and had sexual intercourse while
Staff 1 was checking them in. Staff 1 was provided
corrective action, had a discussion/reminder with
supervisor about already established safety plans, and was
taken off the schedule until the investigation is complete.
Safety plans for Youth A and Youth B were also updated.
• Youth A and Youth B’s safety plans dated 12/2/24 state
staff are to be arm’s length of Youth A when she is within 3
feet of proximity of Youth B. Staff are to verbally redirect
residents to separate and step in if needed. Youth A and
Youth B are not to have blankets in the milieu. Youth A and
Youth B are not to have outings to the YMCA until further
notice. Boundary and Therapy plans were created for each
youth as well.
• Supervision of Coed Milieu Policy states staff are to always
provide protection and supervision to youth in the program,
which includes monitoring to ensure youth are maintaining
appropriate boundaries.
• Managing Community Activities Policy states the home
supervisor, and staff are responsible to assure adequate
staffing is arranged for safety of residents. Staffing required
for an event varies depending on multiple factors (i.e.
number and ability of youth supervised, type of activity,
level of public interaction, length of time of activity, distance
from the facility, and ratio of 4 youth to 1 staff).
• Resident Safety and Supervision Policy outlines
requirements of interval safety checks not to exceed 15
minutes, one-to-one staffing requirements, responding to
suicidal ideation requirements, and completion of room
searches.
• Staff 1 has one disciplinary action in his employee file,
which is a result of this incident. Corrective active notice
6

dated 12/4/24 states Staff 1 must follow all safety
provisions and precautions, as well as always provide
supervision. An email was sent to all staff, including Staff 1,
on 11/15/24 with the safety plans created for Youth A and
Youth B on 11/13/24.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews
conducted and documentation reviewed, Staff 1 did not follow
supervision requirements or youth safety plans, and as a result,
two youth were left unsupervised and had sex on a community
outing.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It is recommended the facility update their supervision and/or
managing community outings policy for community outings to note
only one youth should be in the changing room or restroom at a
time while the rest of the youth stay with an assigned staff. The
facility was provided an example of another CCI’s policy on
12/27/24 for reference.
It is recommended the facility update their managing community
outings policy to include supervision requirements/expectations of
staff while on the community outing.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
